intro: Terminalia gracilipes, commonly known as the slender terminalia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Combretaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and appear in axillary clusters, while the fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule. Terminalia gracilipes is often found in dry, open woodlands and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
